Posted By: Chamale (6/16/2011 3:35:07 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
why doesn't this have 6 stars? :P  
  
this is pure, undiluted card disadvantage. I could say card advantage, but when it comes to black, I prefer to think in terms of the opponents' disadvantage instead of my advantage. Cuz it's more evil that way. :)  
  
There is only one reason I can think of why this card is at ONLY 4.8:   
Missing this line in italics at the bottom-  
  
*"Ask not for who the Bell tolls- it tolls for THEE!"*

posts.post_content: No comments on APNAP (Active Player, Non-Active Player) order? This reads like everyone should simultaneously choose and discard their card, but I believe they actually take turns clockwise from your left. Therefore, regardless of who you're attacking, this favors the players closest to your right over the unfortunates to your left.
posts.html:
No comments on APNAP (Active Player, Non-Active Player) order? Therefore, regardless of who you're attacking, this favors the players closest to your right over the unfortunates to your left.

posts.post_content:
I'm gonna play this in my Damia deck, mostly because I have a huge obsession with using decks that focus on discard and extractor, and in that deck there's a side-focus on group discard and game suppression using discard.. Here I have a decent flier, that causes group discard (use alongside [Geth's Grimoire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Geth's Grimoire) for further abuse).   
  
I honestly don't know how I'm going to test this, because its no one will even play it anymore.. :|

posts.post_content: @Chamale: If you're playing commander and discarding lands when this gets to attack, either someone is doing it wrong, or you're already winning the game. Usually there's a good chance that people will be discarding cards with cmc 7+ when this attacks for the first time in commander. That is, unless you pulled a Sol Ring and a Signet on your first turn.
posts.html:
@Chamale: If you're playing commander and discarding lands when this gets to attack, either someone is doing it wrong, or you're already winning the game.
